name: PTAnywhere development
body:
This website includes very specific and technical information about __PTAnywhere__.
If you are a user or somebody trying to understand what is PTAnywhere, please visit its [official website](http://pt-anywhere.kmi.open.ac.uk/).

Here we will explain what are the Github projects in [PTAnywhere organization](https://github.com/PTAnywhere), how to use them and how to contribute to them.

_PTAnywhere_ is composed by...

 * [Scripts which ease the installation and deployment of all its components](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/ptAnywhere-installation)
 * [An HTTP API for Packet Tracer](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/ptAnywhere-api)
 * [An internal HTTP API for creating different instances of Packet Tracer](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/pt-instances-management)
 * [A set of widgets to interact with Packet Tracer through the web](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/ptAnywhere-widgets)

Additionally, we have also made public the following related projects:

 * [performance-testing](http://ptanywhere.github.io/performance-testing/) is a Python project created to measure the performance of PTAnywhere (specifically the Docker-based _Packet Tracer_ container).
 * [usage-analysis](https://github.com/PTAnywhere/usage-analysis) is an outdated web application which visualises users interaction with the widgets.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
